Hi Richard,

According to the Defense Agency Foreign Language School in Santa Cruz, the
only more difficult language to learn than Japanese is Chinese for us. I
would recommend college courses as a start and then self study of the kanji
related to swords.

Gordon
  -----Original Message-----
  From: Richard George [mailto:rkg@...]
  Sent: Thursday, April 24, 2003 1:21 PM
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: [nihontostudy] goin' Japanese


  Hi,

  This is only peripherally related to sword study, but here goes...

  I've pretty much read through everything sword related that I can find
  that's printed in English, so I guess its time to learn Japanese -
  The question I have is what's the least time consuming way to do this? I
  know this probably sounds stupid, but
  I've studied several other languages in the past (grade school, high
  school, etc.,), and it seemed to be a
  fairly drawn out/painful affair, and I was debatin' whether to just sign
  up for a course at the local college or what...

  thanks,

  rkg
  (Richard George)
